story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in the Philippines, there was a kind and curious young girl named Inna. She lived with her parents and her twin brother, Ivan, in a small house near the edge of the forest.

Inna and Ivan were always exploring the forest and going on adventures together. They loved to see all the different plants and animals that lived there. But one day, Inna and Ivan saw something they had never seen before. It was a tiny bird, with shimmering feathers of all different colors.

The bird was so beautiful that Inna and Ivan couldn't believe their eyes. They watched as it flew from branch to branch, singing a sweet and melodious song.

"We have to catch it!" Ivan exclaimed. "It would make the most beautiful pet!"

But Inna wasn't so sure. She loved all animals and didn't want to hurt the bird or take it away from its home.

"Let's leave it alone, Ivan," she said. "It's happy here in the forest, and it belongs with its own kind."

Ivan was disappointed, but he knew his sister was right. They watched the bird for a few more minutes, then turned to go back home.

As they were walking, they heard a rustling in the bushes behind them. They turned around, and to their surprise, they saw the tiny bird flying towards them!

It landed on Inna's shoulder, chirping happily. Inna was surprised, but she didn't want to scare the bird away. She gently stroked its feathers, and the bird seemed to purr with contentment.

"I guess it likes you, Inna," Ivan said, smiling.

From that day on, the tiny bird was Inna's constant companion. She named it Luna, after the moon, because it was just as beautiful and mystical.

Inna and Luna went on many more adventures together, always respecting the forest and the creatures that lived there. And Luna always made sure to return to her home in the forest at night, to be with her own kind.

And so, Inna learned that by respecting and caring for all living things, she could form a special bond with them, and have a friend for life.

Now it's time for you to close your eyes, my dear, and dream of your own adventures, just like Inna and Luna. Good night, my child. I will always love and protect you, just as Inna loved and protected Luna.
